review_text: Overall a nice clean place. Will consider staying there again.
We stayed in town for our friend’s wedding, this spot was PERFECT for us to get ready and rest after the festivities. Make sure to take a look at the stars!
Booked here last minute and Kellie was informative about everything. Thank you Kellie for the great stay!

We met Kellie and her husband right away because we accidentally turned into the wrong driveway. They were extremely friendly. We found the rental to be even better than expected. Very clean and smelled so nice. Kellie had thought of everything. It is located outside of town which made it so quiet. She and her husband told us that the cicadas had arrived. We actually enjoyed listening to them. But the rental is so tight that we never heard them inside. The bed was soooooo comfortable. We made the decision to always stay there if it’s available when we visit Paragould. We stayed three nights.
Great stay, very clean, and very comfy, if I’m ever working up here again I will be staying again!
The place really nice and clean. It was really quiet and peaceful. Kelli was good about responding when i contacted her.
This perfectly fit my need to be based between Jonesboro and Paragould. The space was flexible and comfortable and I loved being in such a quiet area to get quality rest!
A very pleasant place to stay out in the country. The kind of place we love. And Kellie was especially helpful and gracious as a host. Two thumbs up!
This was such a a cute and cozy place to stay! Loved the dogs, they were so nice!
Perfect all the way around ! Loved it
It was a very clean and well decorated place with a friendly atmosphere and privacy outside the city. It’s a wonderful place.

I can’t say enough about this wonderful little getaway. Absolutely beautiful job on decorating and design. Clean and modern with a private feeling and beautiful surroundings of nature. Love love love it !
We couldn’t say enough good things to explain this little gem! It was a great place all around for privacy and relaxation . Very clean and modern which we like!

It was a bit confusing pulling in, since our GPS told us to pull into the main house entrance and the guest house’s entrance was VERY steep. But it was a cute little house, very clean, and was in a great location. We were out of town, but not too far out that it was an inconvenience to get around. We did see 2 deer when we were there, so that was awesome!
Perfect little getaway! Very friendly. Beautiful place. Super quick responses to my questions. 10/10 would stay again!

Loved the place. A few bugs but not many. Probably there due to previous visitors. Nice shower and restroom. Liked the comforting blankets. Google maps stops at her driveway though and not the Air BnB driveway so it was a little confusing and so is the key pad. Overall enjoyed the house and world recommend.
I always love this place.
The place was very nice and clean. The bed was pretty uncomfortable but we had a wonderful stay and would come back again.

Anyone would feel at home at this house. Well appointed, fresh , clean, roomy, beautiful location and very private. Better than most rentals we have used. I would stay here again 100%. I asked her a question early on and she responded quickly. I cannot rave enough about this location.
Such a cute place in the quiet countryside! Always love booking my employees’ stays with Kellie!
We loved this little home. It was gorgeous clean, and peaceful. We will absolutely be back to stay again, thank you so much for hosting us!
Second time staying here and loved it as much as first time. This was my husband's first time at Kellie's place. He was impressed and felt at home.

Don’t let the plain exterior fool you! You’ll step inside to find a spacious, comfortable, well-appointed retreat. The country setting was lovely and very private! This of the place to stay if you are visiting the Paragould area. We will be back.
Wonderful place to stay. Kellie is an excellent host. Check in was simple and easy. Nice kitchen appliances and bathroom.

Kellie’s place was absolutely perfect! We felt right at home and the area was so peaceful. When we had a question, she got right back with us with an answer. Would 100% stay here again and would absolutely recommend her to others!

adorable little cottage, that was perfect for my granddaughter and me. I am in town at least once a month, and it was nice to have our own space and be able to cook and have a fenced yard for my granddaughter to play in. I felt at home. I will definitely stay here again.

The perfect location for us to see our daughter in Paragould with a new grandbaby, as well as our son and his family in Jonesboro (Brookland)! Our visit could not have been more perfect! It quite possibly could be our new place to stay while visiting our kids!

I was impressed with the cleanliness and we loved the dog that came out to say hi! Definitely a huge plus. We only stayed one night, but there were dishes and utensils that would accommodate a longer stay. I would recommend it!!
Adorable place! Would stay again. Thoughtful design.

Perfect. Like always

I love staying at Kellie’s place! It is clean, very comfortable and the perfect place to stay while visiting my family in the area. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

If you don't like dogs- I would be hesitant to book because she has several that roam the property- we are dog people and did not mind. If you need a quick place to stay- this is perfect but we wish there was a little more privacy overall on the property.
Kellie's place was quiet and quaint. We so enjoyed the location and being out of the way of the city. It's a lovely property and a clean and comfortable home. Would highly recommend and stay again!

This was a return visit for me. The location is close enough that you don't have a long travel time to get necessities, but far enough out that you have a PEACEFUL stay. Kellie's place provides a wonderful view and you feel right at home.

Peaceful place to recharge and relax. I stayed three nights. The home is quiet, clean and lovely. Great AC, comfortable bedding and living room furniture. Free Hulu on the TV. A few books for reading. Nice coffee station to start your mornings.

Visited Crowley Ridge State Park (only 15 minutes away) and ambled down a couple short hiking trails. The hosts are very friendly, respond promptly, and give you your privacy while making it clear that they’re happy to help if you need anything. I would be happy to stay here again!
This was a great stay. Quiet, private, and peaceful. Would come again!

Great place. Well worth the price. Kitchen seemed very well stocked with all essentials. Overall it was exactly what I was looking for in a place to spend the night to break up a long drive.

First ABnB experience and it was great. Super quiet, out of town. Stayed during a storm one night and it was wonderful. Country smell + the frog noises was my favorite. Nice little private place if you’re looking for a quiet country get away. TV had a Roku with lots of streaming services too so that was a plus.

Thank you so much for hosting Kellie.

Stop looking!!!! This is the place you want to be if visiting Jonesboro! Jennifer’s place is immaculate! Nicely decorated, spacious, private, awesome scenery, great pond & only a 10-15 minute drive to stores/shopping. The beds were super comfortable & the view amazing. Every amenity you could ever need. Well equipped kitchen, which was important because I had to cook brunch food items for 65 people (for my daughter’s Baby Shower in town). The highlight is, of course, the LONG HORNS!! My husband kept saying, “This isn’t a trip, this is an experience.” My adult children were just as fascinated with the Long Horns as much as my 3 granddaughter, LOL. Hands down 10/10. You will not go wrong or be disappointed in choosing Jennifer’s place to stay! She & her family are super nice & Dixie will make you feel right at home!! I would definitely stay here again & again!

Loved this beautiful home on the farm. It was so peaceful to sit on the front porch overlooking the lake and watching the cattle walk by. Very comfortable beds and the entire house is relaxing and very clean. Kitchen is the most fully stocked kitchen we have ever had at any of our previous Airbnbs. Our family loved our stay. Thank you!

We had a great stay at this Airbnb! Overall, we liked it and would stay here again. It was easy to find, easy to check in, and it was a comfortable and enjoyable space for our family. We chose this one specifically because of the cows right on the property. They weren’t around as much as we had hoped, but in the evening both nights of our stay they did come and graze very close to the house. Our kids loved that and kept asking about the cows even after we left!
It’s very peaceful and a beautiful view of the countryside.

We loved the open floorplan inside and the open sky outside. Longhorn cattle walking by was a bonus and, of course, Dixie the blue heeler. Total sweetie. I would definitely recommend Jennifer's place.
Everything about our stay was beautiful! The kids loved seeing all of the animals and the lake. The home was immaculate. We enjoyed our stay!

What a wonderful place to stay!!! My family felt right at home, the scenery was so peaceful and our host Jennifer was so friendly and accommodating. I recommend a stay 💯 and will definitely be booking again on our next visit to NEA!!! Thank you Jennifer for being such a wonderful host!!!

It was secluded so we felt very comfortable leaving the boat there while going to town. There was a circle driveway so it was very helpful with the truck and boat trailer. It was more beautiful than the pictures show and we will definately be back every year. The friendly dogs and view of the cattle and horses were definatley a plus! My son left his toiletry bag and she even Fedexed it to us the same day as checkout. Definatley recommend this place!!

Several aspects of this rental didn’t meet expectations, and I offer the following comments in a constructive spirit in hopes that conditions improve as a result. I would have expressed them directly to Sarah, but she was out of town. (In fact, I saw no one at all on the premises for the entirety of my stay.) First off, the positives: The remote setting is peaceful and quiet; even the very inquisitive, super affectionate resident dogs were –thankfully– “bark free”. The compact rental unit was tidy (with the exception of the toilet bowl, which was streaked and obviously had not been cleaned, and a bucket littered with cigarette butts between the two patio chairs on the small outdoor seating area next to the front door). The Keurig capsule coffee machine was in fine working order, but most other aspects of the kitchenette were sadly deficient. Here is an inventory: There was no flatware or eating implements save for a small wicker basket with plastic forks and spoons – no knife of any sort. The drawer labeled “Utensils” contained only scissors and one plastic spoon. No bottle opener or corkscrew. No bowls at all, no plates except for small and flimsy paper plates and a few larger plastic ones that warped and cracked when heating up take-out food in the microwave. For drinking, there was a solitary tall water glass (but four coffee mugs). Some of the missing elements were puzzling: Breakfast cereal and milk were provided, but there were no bowls. Is the guest supposed to use a coffee mug and a plastic spoon to eat the cereal? The small kitchen sink did have dish soap, but no sponge or dish towel. In other respects, there were no hooks to hang clothing or wet items (rather awkward given the heavy rains on both days of my stay), although the unit was adorned with several Christian crosses inscribed with Bible verses. The only potential clothes storage options were a heavy metal bar with one hanger perched precariously under the AC unit and directly above the bed; there was a bureau at the foot of the bed, but the top three drawers were stuffed with extra bedding. As to the bed itself, the mattress was adequate, but the all-polyester sheets were uncomfortable, and the bottom sheet was riddled with pilling. Finally, the Wi-Fi signal was weak (the router must have been in the main house next door): It worked, albeit quite slowly, on my iPad, but not at all on my PC laptop. If Sarah opts to resolve these issues, The Sunroom would be a much more satisfying retreat space.
